thread.title: New music: Baskery's fourth album on the way amid Glastonbury murmurings | Metro News
thread.title_full: New music: Baskery's fourth album on the way amid Glastonbury murmurings | Metro News

author: Achal Dhillon For Metro.Co.Uk
title: New music: Baskery's fourth album on the way amid Glastonbury murmurings | Metro News

organizations.name: metro news achal dhillon for metro.co.uk

text:
Achal Dhillon for Metro.co.uk and Killing Moon Thursday 23 Feb 2017 7:45 am (Picture: Warner Brothers Records) 
Metro.co.uk and record label Killing Moon pick out the new artists you should listen to today. 
Baskery sound like : you’ve just walked into a barn expecting a hoe-down, but instead it’s a pretty slamming club. 
Similar artists : The Staves, The Smoke Fairies, HAIM, Mumford & Sons 
Their story : Baskery are three sisters from Stockholm in Sweden – Greta, Stella and Sunniva. 
They officially formed as a band sometime in 2007, taking their country and punk rock influences towards labels like banjo-punk, mud-country, nordicana and kill-billy. 
They released three albums through various independent labels and built up a steady fanbase around the world. 
Now signed in the US with major label Warner Brothers Records, they’ve released singles Love in LA and Cruel Companion. 
What’s so great about them : Generally, the splicing-together of punk music and country/folk usually means one gives way to the other. 
However Baskery seem to hold to their own, walking the thin line between the genres rather well, shown in formative works such as single Shut The Catflap. 
Their latest singles see them going in a more conventional pop direction after working with pop producer Andrew Dawson and touring with the likes of Robbie Williams. 
Other than that, there’s just not many things cooler than seeing three bad-ass ladies from Sweden rocking out. 
Most-streamed song on Spotify : Love In LA 
Most-recent video : 
What will they be doing in 2017 : Other than cracking on with their major label debut expected for release later this year – meaning more singles are on the way – an awful lot of touring is in the pipeline for Baskery. 
We’ve been told they’re appearing at Bonnaroo, Newport Folk Festival, Glastonbury and SXSW, though a couple of those are waiting on official confirmation.
